Posts.Content: Thanks for that, will have an MRI , rather than wait for the 3 month f/u recommended.
Posts.Title: Cyst left breast - cause for concern

Posts.Content: Hi, My good friend was told she has a cyst on her left breast after a routine mammogram followed by an ultrasound. Doctor recommends a followup test in 3 months. Is there cause for concern? thanks,
Posts.Title: Cyst left breast - cause for concern

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear your news about your mother. At this point, try not to worry. You don't have all the details. Is your dad alive? You need to be there for your mom, so panicking now will do you and her no good. It could be a long road or a short one, you really don't know and have to believe that what lies ahead will unravel as it should. Best
Posts.Title: just found out my mom has breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi all, My friend was told her mammogram showed a shadow and she had to have another check done, today. Does anyone know if this is just a routine check or should she be concerned?
Posts.Title: Shadow on the mammogram means?

Posts.Content: HELLO, Are you HER +, my husband is and was on herceptin with xeloda, did not work for his primary tumour, now on FOLFIRI,, perhaps this combo may work for you... check with the oncologist
Posts.Title: Any advice after failure of using Xeloda and other chemo

Posts.Content: HELLO, Did you get tested for the HeR gene?? Just curious, as there are specific targetted therapies for this.
Posts.Title: Newbie - PET Scan Showing lesions in bone of Spine

Posts.Content: Hi, I would suggest you confirm if Herceptin will be the chemo of choice... if ER + as your biopsy states... You need to find out what genes you are showing positive?
Posts.Title: Newbie - PET Scan Showing lesions in bone of Spine

Posts.Content: In Canada, the doctor will often arrange for the drug on compassionate grounds if there is no benefit plan for the sick.. perhaps you can write to the drug company... and see if they will do the same...
Posts.Title: Prescriptions from Canada?

Posts.Content: Hello to all, Should one be concerned if a mammogram shows no evidence of breast cancer, although the breast tissue is dense. It is recommend to test with a mammogram in one year... Thanks, I thought that if the tissue is dense, breast ca may not be detectable.
Posts.Title: Dense breast tissue

Posts.Content: Hi again, Yes , the waiting for those damn scan results is terrifying, we have on in late Sept and I am already worked up about it. If it is bad news, it will be like riding a roller coaster ride. Take care Best to you,
Posts.Title: Herceptin and increased tumor markers

Posts.Content: Hello, My husband was on herceptin for 6 rounds he has stage iv EC, his primary tumour increase in size to 6x 6cm... so he is now on a new chemo regimen, Folfiri... Herceptin has received a lot of success for breast cancer patients and recently introduced to EC.
Posts.Title: Herceptin and increased tumor markers

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa, You might carry the worry gene, a lot of people have it. Cancer is like a thief in the night... it enters someone`s life and then continues to haunt them. I am a cargiver for my husband who has stage iv EC. There isn`t a day go by that I don`t think what next... I like many others are learning to take one day at a time.. we are not in control of our lives.. our Divine Lord is , we have to wait on him and do his will. Easier said than done... Whatever, you did before the big C came along, try to keep it going... finding a counsellor may help to keep you on track... for the first time I asked myself . so much emphasis is put on cancer, yet there are people walking around with diabetes, obesity, heart issues and on and on.. they must be on a roller coaster ride too... For now, make life simple and we can all try to smell the roses... The Glass is only half full- keep a smile on and the will to choose... Take Care and God Bless PS I have gained 10 pounds since Dec. 2011, I am doing skating twice aÂ  week and walking and sometimes the gym.. it is from the stress...
Posts.Title: Life after cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks to all you have commented, I have taken bioidentical hormones over the last several years.. I have read taking the creams can cause an increase of breast tissue... I will ask my primary care physician if I should be taking more tests. any other comments appreciated.
Posts.Title: Dense breast tissue

Posts.Content: Hi Miscom, I am happy to hear you are doing well on Herceptin, my husband carries the HER 2 gene too , but has esophageal cancer stage iv. He takes Xeloda as well. You say you have been on Herceptin for 2 years.. what have your docs told you about taking this drug.. is there a limit to how long you can take it... do you take Xeloda as well. Do you have any research info on the outcomes when taking this drug... what are the stories with the women you know who are living for more than 10 years... I think it is wonderful that science has led to crossover use for Herceptin, ie the drug was first used on breast ca patients, but now is being used for EC patients.... Thanks,
Posts.Title: stage 4 triple positive breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hello ladies , I have a friend who was diagnosed with brain ca, had radiation to her head and started to lose her hair. Vanity set in and she started to complain about the loss of hair.. remember hair grows back, it's a small thing and can be replaced, your health is far more important. Wishing everyone a speedy recovery and hoping vanity has not become part of your life. My husband was diagnosed with stage iv EC and also had to take chemo and his hair went wonky, didn't lose it, but it grows in slightly curly, he complains as well.. and IÂ have to just sigh.. trying to tell him to put it all in perspective. He's in training paints.... LOL Heads upÂ to all....
Posts.Title: Scared about losing hair

Posts.Content: Hello, I am looking for advice, my dear friend has just finished surgery for triple negative grade 3Â breast cancer, will take chemo and radiation, what does the triple negative stuff mean. I understand the higher the grade the more advanced the cancer, but not clear on the interpretation. Â  Thanks for your help
Posts.Title: Triple negative breast ca, what does it mean?
